data.question: What is the effect of the core metal ion (Fe3+ vs Co3+) on MOF structure?
data.answer: The effect of the metal ion (Fe3+ vs Co3+) on MOF structure was generally found to be negligible.

data.question: How does the choice of anion affect MOF topology?
data.answer: The choice of anion was found to have a pronounced effect on the MOF topology.

data.question: What nets are formed with salts of AgO3SCF3 and AgBF4?
data.answer: Networks prepared with salts of AgO3SCF3 and AgBF4 reliably formed three-dimensional (10,3) nets.

data.question: What is the result of using AgPF6 and AgSbF6 in MOF synthesis?
data.answer: Use of AgPF6 and AgSbF6 produced two-dimensional (6,3) honeycomb nets.

data.question: Can anion exchange affect MOF topology?
data.answer: True

data.question: Is the coordinative ability of the anion significant in observed templating effect?
data.answer: False

data.question: Does changing the length of the tris(dipyrrinato) metalloligand affect MOF topology?
data.answer: True

data.question: What happens when [Co(4-pyrdpm)3], [Fe(4-pyrdpm)3], and AgBF4 are combined?
data.answer: Dark-green crystals of MOF-CoFe/AgBF4-1 are obtained, which is a (10,3)-d net.

data.question: What is the topology of MOFs formed with [M(4-quindpm)3] and AgOTf?
data.answer: The structure of MOF-Fe/AgOTf-3 reveals a (10,3)-b net.

data.question: What is the effect of extending the metalloligand framework on MOF topology?
data.answer: Extension of the metalloligand framework by insertion of a rigid phenylethynyl spacer results in the formation of extended (6,3) nets regardless of the anion used.

data.question: Are the MOFs described in the study thermally stable?
data.answer: True

data.question: Do MOFs undergo single-crystal-to-single-crystal transformations during anion exchange?
data.answer: True

data.question: Can multimetallic MOFs be prepared using the described synthetic approach?
data.answer: True

data.question: What is the role of hydrogen bonding in the anion templating effect?
data.answer: The role of hydrogen bonding in the anion templating effect is not fully understood and requires further investigation.

data.question: How does the size of the anion influence the MOF structure?
data.answer: The size of the anion alone is not sufficient to explain the templating effect observed in the MOFs.

data.question: Is the synthesis of MOFs with predictable structures possible?
data.answer: True

data.question: Does the study provide a strategy for constructing new MOFs?
data.answer: True

data.question: Are the MOFs described in the study suitable for anion exchange applications?
data.answer: True

data.question: Can the choice of metalloligand metal ion add new properties to the MOF without altering its physical robustness?
data.answer: True

data.question: Is the anion templating effect observed in the MOFs due to kinetic or thermodynamic differences?
data.answer: It is unclear whether the anion templating effect is due to kinetic or thermodynamic differences.
